get.description: PythonPackageContent represents each individually installable Python package. In the Python ecosystem, this is called a Python Distribution, sometimes (ambiguously) refered to as a package. In Pulp Python, we refer to it as PythonPackageContent. Each PythonPackageContent corresponds to a single filename, for example `pulpcore-3.0.0rc1-py3-none-any.whl` or `pulpcore-3.0.0rc1.tar.gz`.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Filter results where name matches value

parameters.name: name__in
parameters.description: Filter results where name is in a comma-separated list of values

parameters.name: author
parameters.description: Filter results where author matches value

parameters.name: author__in
parameters.description: Filter results where author is in a comma-separated list of values

parameters.name: packagetype
parameters.description: Filter results where packagetype matches value

parameters.name: packagetype__in
parameters.description: Filter results where packagetype is in a comma-separated list of values

parameters.name: filename
parameters.description: Filter results where filename matches value

parameters.name: filename__in
parameters.description: Filter results where filename is in a comma-separated list of values

parameters.name: filename__contains
parameters.description: Filter results where filename contains value

parameters.name: keywords__in
parameters.description: Filter results where keywords is in a comma-separated list of values

parameters.name: keywords__contains
parameters.description: Filter results where keywords contains value

parameters.name: repository_version
parameters.description: Repository Version referenced by HREF

parameters.name: repository_version_added
parameters.description: Repository Version referenced by HREF

parameters.name: repository_version_removed
parameters.description: Repository Version referenced by HREF

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: A page number within the paginated result set.

parameters.name: page_size
parameters.description: Number of results to return per page.

post.description: This endpoint is part of the Upload workflow. Create a PythonPackageContent here by specifying an uploaded Artifact. `pulp-python` will inspect parse the metadata directly from the file.

get.description: PythonPackageContent represents each individually installable Python package. In the Python ecosystem, this is called a Python Distribution, sometimes (ambiguously) refered to as a package. In Pulp Python, we refer to it as PythonPackageContent. Each PythonPackageContent corresponds to a single filename, for example `pulpcore-3.0.0rc1-py3-none-any.whl` or `pulpcore-3.0.0rc1.tar.gz`.

parameters.name: python_package_content_href
parameters.description: URI of Python Package Content. e.g.: /pulp/api/v3/content/python/packages/1/

get.description: Pulp Python Distributions are used to distribute Python Publications. Pulp Python Distributions should not be confused with "Python Distribution" as defined by the Python community. In Pulp usage, Python content is refered to as Python Package Content.

parameters.name: name__in
parameters.description: Filter results where name is in a comma-separated list of values

parameters.name: base_path__contains
parameters.description: Filter results where base_path contains value

parameters.name: base_path__icontains
parameters.description: Filter results where base_path contains value

parameters.name: base_path__in
parameters.description: Filter results where base_path is in a comma-separated list of values

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: A page number within the paginated result set.

parameters.name: page_size
parameters.description: Number of results to return per page.

get.description: Pulp Python Distributions are used to distribute Python Publications. Pulp Python Distributions should not be confused with "Python Distribution" as defined by the Python community. In Pulp usage, Python content is refered to as Python Package Content.

patch.description: Trigger an asynchronous partial update task

parameters.name: python_distribution_href
parameters.description: URI of Python Distribution. e.g.: /pulp/api/v3/distributions/python/pypi/1/

get.description:
<!-- User-facing documentation, rendered as html-->
Python Publications refer to the Python Package content in a repository version, and include
metadata about that content.

parameters.name: ordering
parameters.description: Which field to use when ordering the results.

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: A page number within the paginated result set.

parameters.name: page_size
parameters.description: Number of results to return per page.

post.description: Trigger an asynchronous task to publish python content.

get.description:
<!-- User-facing documentation, rendered as html-->
Python Publications refer to the Python Package content in a repository version, and include
metadata about that content.

delete.description:
<!-- User-facing documentation, rendered as html-->
Python Publications refer to the Python Package content in a repository version, and include
metadata about that content.

parameters.name: python_publication_href
parameters.description: URI of Python Publication. e.g.: /pulp/api/v3/publications/python/pypi/1/

get.description: Python Remotes are representations of an external repository of Python content, eg. PyPI. Fields include upstream repository config. Python Remotes are also used to `sync` from upstream repositories, and contains sync settings.

parameters.name: _last_updated
parameters.description: ISO 8601 formatted dates are supported

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: A page number within the paginated result set.

parameters.name: page_size
parameters.description: Number of results to return per page.

post.description: Python Remotes are representations of an external repository of Python content, eg. PyPI. Fields include upstream repository config. Python Remotes are also used to `sync` from upstream repositories, and contains sync settings.

get.description: Python Remotes are representations of an external repository of Python content, eg. PyPI. Fields include upstream repository config. Python Remotes are also used to `sync` from upstream repositories, and contains sync settings.

patch.description: Trigger an asynchronous partial update task

parameters.name: python_remote_href
parameters.description: URI of Python Remote. e.g.: /pulp/api/v3/remotes/python/python/1/

post.description:
<!-- User-facing documentation, rendered as html-->
Trigger an asynchronous task to sync python content. The sync task will retrieve Python
content from the specified `Remote` and " update the specified `Respository`, creating a
new  `RepositoryVersion`.

parameters.name: python_remote_href
parameters.description: URI of Python Remote. e.g.: /pulp/api/v3/remotes/python/python/1/

name.title: Name
name.description: A string giving a single classification value for a Python package.

_artifact.title: artifact
_artifact.description: Artifact file representing the physical content

_relative_path.title: relative path
_relative_path.description: Path where the artifact is located relative to distributions base_path

filename.title: Filename
filename.description: The name of the distribution package, usually of the format: {distribution}-{version}(-{build tag})?-{python tag}-{abi tag}-{platform tag}.{packagetype}

packagetype.title: Packagetype
packagetype.description: The type of the distribution package (e.g. sdist, bdist_wheel, bdist_egg, etc)

name.title: Name
name.description: The name of the python project.

summary.title: Summary
summary.description: A one-line summary of what the package does.

description.title: Description
description.description: A longer description of the package that can run to several paragraphs.

keywords.title: Keywords
keywords.description: Additional keywords to be used to assist searching for the package in a larger catalog.

home_page.title: Home page
home_page.description: The URL for the package's home page.

download_url.title: Download url
download_url.description: Legacy field denoting the URL from which this package can be downloaded.

author.title: Author
author.description: Text containing the author's name. Contact information can also be added, separated with newlines.

maintainer.title: Maintainer
maintainer.description: The maintainer's name at a minimum; additional contact information may be provided.

license.title: License
license.description: Text indicating the license covering the distribution

requires_python.title: Requires python
requires_python.description: The Python version(s) that the distribution is guaranteed to be compatible with.

project_url.title: Project url
project_url.description: A browsable URL for the project and a label for it, separated by a comma.

platform.title: Platform
platform.description: A comma-separated list of platform specifications, summarizing the operating systems supported by the package.

supported_platform.title: Supported platform
supported_platform.description: Field to specify the OS and CPU for which the binary package was compiled.

requires_dist.title: Requires dist
requires_dist.description: A JSON list containing names of some other distutils project required by this distribution.

provides_dist.title: Provides dist
provides_dist.description: A JSON list containing names of a Distutils project which is contained within this distribution.

obsoletes_dist.title: Obsoletes dist
obsoletes_dist.description: A JSON list containing names of a distutils project's distribution which this distribution renders obsolete, meaning that the two projects should not be installed at the same time.

requires_external.title: Requires external
requires_external.description: A JSON list containing some dependency in the system that the distribution is to be used.

base_path.title: Base path
base_path.description: The base (relative) path component of the published url. Avoid paths that                     overlap with other distribution base paths (e.g. "foo" and "foo/bar")

base_url.title: Base url
base_url.description: The URL for accessing the publication as defined by this distribution.

remote.title: Remote
remote.description: Remote that can be used to fetch content when using pull-through caching.

repository.title: Repository
repository.description: A URI of the repository to be published.

distributions.description: This publication is currently being hosted as configured by these distributions.

items.description: This publication is currently being hosted as configured by these distributions.

ProjectSpecifier.description:
AKA "Whitelist". A list of dictionaries, expand for more information.
        Example:

        [{"name": "django", "version_specifier":"~=2.0"}]

version_specifier.title: Version specifier
version_specifier.description: A version specifier accepts standard python versions syntax: `>=`, `<=`, `==`, `~=`, `>`, `<`, `!` and can be used in conjunction with other specifiers i.e. `>1`,`<=3`,`!=3.0.2`. Note that the specifiers treat pre-released versions as `<` released versions, so 3.0.0a1 < 3.0.0. Not setting the version_specifier will sync all the pre-released and released versions.

name.title: Name
name.description: A unique name for this remote.

url.title: Url
url.description: The URL of an external content source.

validate.title: Validate
validate.description: If True, the plugin will validate imported artifacts.

ssl_ca_certificate.title: Ssl ca certificate
ssl_ca_certificate.description: A PEM encoded CA certificate used to validate the server certificate presented by the remote server. Returns SHA256 sum on GET.

ssl_client_certificate.title: Ssl client certificate
ssl_client_certificate.description: A PEM encoded client certificate used for authentication. Returns SHA256 sum on GET.

ssl_client_key.title: Ssl client key
ssl_client_key.description: A PEM encoded private key used for authentication. Returns SHA256 sum on GET.

ssl_validation.title: Ssl validation
ssl_validation.description: If True, SSL peer validation must be performed.

username.title: Username
username.description: The username to be used for authentication when syncing.

password.title: Password
password.description: The password to be used for authentication when syncing.

_last_updated.title: last updated
_last_updated.description: Timestamp of the most recent update of the remote.

policy.title: Policy
policy.description: The policy to use when downloading content. The possible values include: 'immediate', 'on_demand', and 'cache_only'. 'immediate' is the default.

includes.description:
AKA "Whitelist". A list of dictionaries, expand for more information.
        Example:

        [{"name": "django", "version_specifier":"~=2.0"}]

excludes.description:
"AKA "Blacklist". A list of dictionaries, expand for more information.
        Example:

        [{"name": "django", "version_specifier":"~=2.0"}]

prereleases.title: Prereleases
prereleases.description: Whether or not to include pre-release packages in the sync.

repository.title: Repository
repository.description: A URI of the repository to be synchronized.

mirror.title: Mirror
mirror.description: If ``True``, synchronization will remove all content that is not present in the remote repository. If ``False``, sync will be additive only.
